measured_by: α parameter (power-utility exponent) estimated from expected-utility transformation
justification: “we first estimated a parameter α that is commonly used to capture risk aversion by transforming EV to EU … A value of α close to 1 indicates no influence of risk, whereas a value of α lesser/greater than 1 indicates risk aversion/seeking.”
“we focused on the maximum deviation (MD) of the trajectories, which indexes choice uncertainty and the competition between response alternatives (Hehman et al., 2015; Spivey et al., 2005).”
construct: Choice uncertainty / competition between response alternatives

measured_by: response time (RT) from stimulus onset to button press
justification: “Standard psychometric findings would show that … RTs are longest … when the decision variable … is closest to zero,” linking longer RT to harder (more difficult) decisions.

measured_by: SAL categorical variable based on an attribute value ≥ 1.5 × second-highest on screen
justification: “SAL is a categorical variable reflecting the fact that for each trial, either the probability or the amount of money is particularly salient, as it has a high value that is at least 1.5 times greater than the second-highest value on display.”
